result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey C Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: on or near Certain Places], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: on or near Certain Places], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cases 15CF106, 15CF76, 13CM534 & 15CM120 called at 8:54 am [Clerk SH] (Cases 13CM534 & 15CM120 for review only)
Defendant Corey C Johnson in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Rhiel submits two letters in support of Defendant; Sentencing Arguments by Counsel; Statement by Cheryl Johnson

On Counts #1 & #2-15CF106 & Counts #1 & #2-15CF76, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--serve 4 months in Jefferson County Jail (Ct#1-15CF106), with Huber/Work-release privileges for purposes of employment, treatment, therapy and counseling; to commence 3/18/16 at 6:00 pm  
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random drug and/or alcohol screening
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or engage in treatment, per Agent
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No possession of drug paraphernalia
--No contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA Surcharge on each count
--To submit DNA Sample upon request
--To pay $75 drug testing fee (Ct#1-15CF106)
--To pay $300 buy money reimbursement (Ct#1-15CF106)
--To pay $50 drug testing fee (Ct#1-15CF76)
--100 hours community service, pursuant to 961.495 (15CF76 only)
Court has no objection to Mr. Johnson travelling to Florida to attend treatment program at White Sands or another appropriate treatment program

Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] case called at 1:36pm. 
Defendant Corey C Johnson appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Yelena Zarwell (PD appears for bond purposes only; no eligibility evaluation has been done because Mr. Johnson has indicated he intends to hire private counsel).  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Mr. Johnson verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are current. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
Right to counsel given.

The Court requires a $5,000  signature bond, with conditions:
--to maintain absolute sobriety :no possession or ingestion of alcohol, no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of any injection needles for any purpose 
--booking at the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office today 
recess 1:42pm.
